documentType: FBI agent affidavit or professional summary
summary: This document appears to be a professional summary or affidavit from an FBI agent detailing their experience, particularly focusing on their role as the case agent for the Jeffrey Epstein investigation. It describes the agent's work on child exploitation cases, international coordination, and specific details about the Epstein investigation including search warrants, overseas travel, and victim interviews.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of a high-profile child sex trafficking and sexual exploitation investigation. The agent coordinated his apprehension upon return to New York and planned the search of his home.

persons.name: Alboushari
persons.context: A subject escorted back to the United States from Riyadh to face prosecution in December 2022, as part of an international parental kidnapping case.

connections.description: The FBI agent was the case agent for the Jeffrey Epstein investigation, responsible for planning his apprehension, search warrants, and coordinating international aspects of the case.

events.title: Agent joins NY Child Exploitation Task Force
events.description: The FBI agent became a member of the New York Child Exploitation & Human Trafficking Task Force.

events.title: Epstein investigation and arrest
events.description: A three-year investigation into Jeffrey Epstein for child sex trafficking and sexual exploitation, involving international coordination, his arrest upon return to New York, and execution of multiple domestic and international search warrants.

events.title: Recovery of abducted children
events.description: Six children, aged 2 to 11, were recovered in March 2022 after their father abducted them. The agent worked with INTERPOL to coordinate their return.

events.title: Extradition of Alboushari
events.description: The agent coordinated with the FBI Legat office in Riyadh to travel and escort subject Alboushari back to the United States to face prosecution.

events.title: VCACU Training
events.description: The agent attended the VCACU Protecting Victims of Child Sex Trafficking Training in San Diego, CA, and the DOJ ICAC National Law Enforcement Training in Atlanta, GA.

events.title: ESEC Coordination Meeting
events.description: The agent attended the ESEC Coordination Meeting in Linthicum, MD.

locations: X island (location of Epstein's 45,000 sq ft home)
keyFacts: The author was the FBI case agent for the Jeffrey Epstein child sex trafficking investigation.
The Epstein investigation was a three-year, high-profile case involving international connections, overseas partners, and the State Department.
The agent planned and executed the search of Epstein's 45,000 square foot home on an island (location redacted).
The agent traveled overseas (Paris, London, etc.) to work with foreign law enforcement to locate and interview witnesses for the Epstein case.
The document highlights the agent's extensive experience in international investigations, including parental kidnappings and coordination with INTERPOL, CBP, and the Department of State.
